intro: Lippia grisea, commonly known as gray lippia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, grayish-green foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Lippia grisea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
